title: Trump's 90-Day Reprieve for TikTok Amid US Ban Considerations
summary:
- Donald Trump plans to give TikTok a 90-day reprieve from a potential US ban after taking office.
- This move comes as TikTok's parent company faces a Sunday deadline to divest to a non-Chinese buyer or risk being banned.
- TikTok ceased operations in the US on January 19, 2025, after being removed from app stores due to Congressional mandates.
- The Supreme Court ruled the law banning TikTok as constitutional shortly before the ban deadline.
- TikTok's CEO has appealed for Trump's intervention to keep the app available in the US.
- Users received notifications regarding the app’s unavailability, with mentions of Trump's potential assistance.

sources.title: Trump says he will likely grant TikTok a 90-day reprieve from US ban when he takes office
TikTok goes dark in the US ahead of ban

title: TikTok Temporarily Unavailable in the US Due to Federal Ban
summary:
- TikTok is going offline in the US due to a federal ban effective January 19th.
- Users received notifications about the temporary unavailability with promises of quick restoration efforts.
- The ban follows a bill signed by Biden in April and upheld by the Supreme Court.
- Trump plans to extend the ban deadline by 90 days after taking office on January 20th.
- TikTok users are upset, focusing pressure on politicians to reverse the ban rather than on the company's sale options.
- TikTok has been removed from Apple and Google’s app stores in the US and is currently unavailable on the web.
- The shutdown affects approximately 170 million users in the US, a significant social media impact.
- The ban-or-divest law is taking effect, which could force ByteDance to sell TikTok or shut it down.
- TikTok has communicated to employees that they are seeking to restore services with the cooperation of the incoming Trump administration.
- The app began displaying messages about the ban to users starting January 19th.
- Other apps owned by TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance, also faced shutdowns.
- TikTok's lack of clarity on its future remains, as it sues the US government over the ban.

sources.title: TikTok will be ‘temporarily unavailable’ in the US starting tonight
TikTok is down in the US

title: Apple, Google remove TikTok from their US app stores + Trump ‘most likely’ to give TikTok 90-day extension to avoid ban
summary:
- Trump is considering a 90-day extension for TikTok to avoid a ban.
- The extension would provide TikTok more time to negotiate terms with the U.S. government.
- This decision indicates ongoing discussions about TikTok's operations in the U.S. amid security concerns.
- Apple and Google removed TikTok from US app stores on Jan. 18 after a Supreme Court decision upheld the ban.
- TikTok has confirmed that it has stopped operations nationwide.
- Users now see messages indicating TikTok is unavailable when trying to access the app.
- Other ByteDance services, like Lemon8, are also unavailable in the US.
- President-elect Donald Trump hinted at a potential 90-day extension for TikTok to comply with the law.

sources.title: Trump ‘most likely’ to give TikTok 90-day extension to avoid ban
Apple, Google remove TikTok from their US app stores

title: Creators urge Biden to protect TikTok from upcoming ban
summary:
- TikTok users urge U.S. government to prevent a ban on the app scheduled for Jan. 19.
- A lawyer for content creators requested assurance from the Biden administration regarding TikTok's availability in app stores.
- The letter calls for a delay in enforcing the law until clearer guidelines are issued, warning that TikTok could cease operations under new regulations.

sources.title: Creators urge Biden to protect TikTok from upcoming ban

title: OpenAI prepares to roll out o3 mini AI model
summary:
- OpenAI plans to release its new AI model, o3 mini, in the coming weeks.
- CEO Sam Altman announced that the launch will include an API and integrate user feedback with ChatGPT.
- The initial launch was targeted for January 2025, with a full o3 model expected later.
- These models aim to enhance OpenAI’s capabilities in tackling complex tasks in science, coding, and mathematics.
- This announcement occurs amidst growing competition in the AI industry, particularly from Alphabet, Google's parent company.

sources.title: OpenAI prepares to roll out o3 mini AI model

title: TikTok goes dark in the US
summary:
- TikTok has been banned in the U.S. due to a federal law affecting millions of users.
- The ban took effect around 10:30 p.m. Eastern, with the app removed from Apple and Google Play stores.
- TikTok indicated the disappearence might be temporary, with hopes for a resolution under President-elect Donald Trump.
- The law requires TikTok’s owner, ByteDance, to sell the app or face a ban due to security concerns.
- The Supreme Court upheld the ban, leaving TikTok’s future to be determined by the incoming administration.
- Alternatives to TikTok like RedNote and Lemon8 are gaining popularity as users seek new platforms.

sources.title: TikTok goes dark in the US

title: Zomato invests $57.7m in Blinkit amid quick commerce race
summary:
- Zomato has invested approximately 500 crore rupees (around US$57.7 million) in Blinkit, its quick commerce subsidiary.
- Blinkit issued 2,537 equity shares at 19.7 lakh rupees (around US$22,754) each as part of this investment.
- This funding follows Zomato's prior fundraising of 8,500 crore rupees (around US$980.9 million) through its first qualified institutional placement (QIP).
- From the QIP, 2,137 crore rupees (around US$246.6 million) were allocated for developing Blinkit's dark stores and Hyperpure's warehouses.
- Zomato has made a total investment of 2,300 crore rupees (around US$265.4 million) in Blinkit since its acquisition in August 2022, including a previous investment of 300 crore rupees (around US$34.6 million) in June 2024.

sources.title: Zomato invests $57.7m in Blinkit amid quick commerce race

title: US calls ChatGPT executive in Google antitrust case
summary:
- The DOJ has called Nick Turley, head of product at OpenAI’s ChatGPT, to testify in its antitrust case against Google.
- This follows a 2024 ruling classifying Google as a monopoly in search, which Google is currently appealing.
- Turley will testify about generative AI's role in search, data-sharing, and market access.
- Google has subpoenaed OpenAI for documents dating back to before ChatGPT’s 2022 launch, which OpenAI is contesting as excessive.
- A court intervention is being sought to limit Google's demands; the testimony date remains pending.

sources.title: US calls ChatGPT executive in Google antitrust case

title: Duolingo Sees Surge in Mandarin Learners Amid TikTok Ban
summary:
- Duolingo reported a 216% increase in U.S. users learning Mandarin due to TikTok's impending ban scheduled for January 19.
- Over 700 million users are migrating to the Chinese app RedNote, also known as Xiaohongshu in China.
- Many new Duolingo users cited TikTok as their source of discovery for the language learning platform.
- The U.S. Supreme Court has upheld laws effectively banning TikTok, with operations set to cease unless the company divests.
- Users in the U.S. are transitioning to RedNote as an alternative platform.
- Mark Cuban is looking to fund a TikTok alternative built on Bluesky’s AT Protocol.

sources.title: ‘Welcome, TikTok refugee’: Duolingo sees a 216% spike in U.S. users learning Mandarin
What we know about the TikTok ban

title: Investigation and Impact of PowerSchool’s Data Breach
summary:
- A cyberattack on PowerSchool was discovered on December 28, endangering data of millions of students and teachers.
- Credentials were stolen from a PowerSchool engineer's computer by LummaC2 malware prior to the breach.
- The engineer's device was hacked in January 2024, with logs showing stolen passwords for internal systems.
- PowerSchool's compromised account did not have multi-factor authentication, a feature now implemented.
- Sensitive personal information, including Social Security and medical data, was exposed for over 60 million students across 18,000 schools.
- Affected districts are analyzing the extent of data theft through collaborative efforts.
- On January 7, PowerSchool notified Romy Backus of the breach, prompting an investigation and sharing of findings with other impacted schools.

sources.title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer
How victims of PowerSchool’s data breach helped each other investigate ‘massive’ hack

title: Canoo EV Startup Files for Chapter 7 Bankruptcy and Ceases Operations
summary:
- Canoo has filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and will cease operations immediately.
- The company owes between $10 million and $50 million to fewer than 49 creditors and claims to have less than $50,000 in assets.
- Canoo struggled to secure funding from the U.S. Department of Energy and had previously furloughed employees and idled its factory in Oklahoma.
- Canoo estimates assets worth $126 million while owing over $164 million to creditors.
- A Bankruptcy Trustee will oversee the liquidation of assets.
- Canoo cited a lack of support from the US Department of Energy and foreign investors as reasons for its filing.
- The company had previously signaled financial troubles by idling operations and putting employees on unpaid breaks last month.
- Canoo has lost several executives, including its founders.

sources.title: EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy and ceases operations
EV startup Canoo has filed for bankruptcy

title: When kids set their parents’ screen time rules: ‘I hit my limit before I even get out of bed’
summary:
- Discussion on the disparity in screen time regulation between children and parents.
- Parents often overlook their own screen time habits, impacting familial interaction and child development.
- The author experimented with her teenage son's screen time limits, revealing challenges and insights about technology use in family dynamics.

sources.title: When kids set their parents’ screen time rules: ‘I hit my limit before I even get out of bed’

title: The mad dash to protect environmental data from Donald Trump
summary:
- Advocates warn that important environmental and public health datasets may be at risk with Donald Trump back in office.
- Significant cuts to federal agencies, including the EPA, could hinder data collection and access.
- The Environmental Justice Screening and Mapping Tool (EJScreen) is at risk due to proposed budget cuts and staffing reductions.
- A grassroots effort, the Environmental Data and Governance Initiative (EDGI), successfully archived significant data during Trump's first term.
- Current preparations are more robust to prevent data loss compared to 2016, utilizing new web tools and collaborative suggestions.

sources.title: The mad dash to protect environmental data from Donald Trump

title: Antonblast is an out-of-control platformer with its heart in the ’90s
summary: - Antonblast is a fast-paced platformer reminiscent of '90s games, launched in 2024. - Developed by Summitsphere, it combines elements from games like Sonic, Wario, and Crash Bandicoot. - Players control Anton or Annie to retrieve stolen spirits across 12 unique levels featuring various themes and mechanics, - The gameplay encourages building momentum and is designed to create a flow state despite its chaotic nature. - The game includes tough platforming challenges and epic boss fights that can be frustrating but are balanced by quick reloads. - Antonblast is available on Nintendo Switch and Steam.

sources.title: Antonblast is an out-of-control platformer with its heart in the ’90s

title: Perplexity Seeks Merger with TikTok US Amid Ban Threats
summary:
- White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre labeled TikTok's threat to go offline as a 'stunt'.
- TikTok indicated it would shut down unless reassurances from Apple and Google regarding liability were provided.
- TikTok CEO Shou Chew thanked Trump for his support, hinting at an appeal for leniency.
- Trump mentioned a possible '90-day extension' on the TikTok ban, which may be legally uncertain.
- Perplexity is reportedly looking to merge with TikTok US amidst this tumultuous situation.
- The potential merger could significantly impact both companies' futures in the US market.

sources.title: Biden White House says TikTok’s threat to go dark is a ‘stunt’
Perplexity said to bid to merge with TikTok US amid looming ban

title: Perplexity AI submits bid to merge with TikTok
summary:
- Perplexity AI has submitted a bid to merge with TikTok US amid a looming ban in the U.S.
- The merger aims to create a new entity combining Perplexity, TikTok US, and additional equity partners.
- A law requiring ByteDance to sell TikTok or face a ban is set to take effect on January 19, the last day of President Biden's administration.
- President-elect Trump indicated he may offer TikTok a 90-day extension to avoid being banned.

sources.title: Perplexity AI submits bid to merge with TikTok

title: Microsoft opens testing for Windows AI search
summary:
- Microsoft is testing AI-powered Windows search for Windows 11 Insider testers in a new dev channel build.
- The feature allows users to search for local files using casual language via semantic indexing, available on Copilot Plus PCs.
- AI search operates offline for locally indexed files, supporting formats like JPEG, PNG, PDF, TXT, and XLS.
- Users can customize indexed locations through Settings; future updates will include cloud data from OneDrive.
- The rollout of AI search will eventually extend to Intel and AMD Copilot Plus computers, supporting multiple languages: Chinese, English, French, German, Japanese, and Spanish.
- The update also features AI writing tools with options to refine text and correct grammar.

sources.title: Microsoft opens testing for Windows AI search

title: Genshin Impact’s developer to pay $20 million fine to settle FTC charges
summary:
- The FTC announced Cognosphere, developer of Genshin Impact, will pay a $20 million settlement for misleading marketing practices.
- Allegations include actively marketing loot boxes to children and deceiving them about in-game transaction costs.
- Settlement requires deletion of data for children under 13 without parental consent and prohibits misrepresenting loot box pricing and odds.

sources.title: Genshin Impact’s developer to pay $20 million fine to settle FTC charges

title: American EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy, ceases operations
summary:
- American electric vehicle (EV) startup Canoo filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy on Jan. 17.
- The company ceased operations due to significant financial difficulties, a high cash burn rate, and challenges in securing funding.
- Canoo's cargo vans had a unique design inspired by microbuses but struggled to gain traction in the competitive EV market.

sources.title: American EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy, ceases operations

title: How to bulk download and save your TikTok videos
summary:
- TikTok may be banned in the US starting January 19th, prompting creators to download their videos.
- TikTok allows data download in TXT or JSON, but not videos directly.
- Recommended methods for bulk downloading:
  - **Repurpose.io**: Subscription-based app for bulk transfers to cloud services, offering free limited downloads.
  - **DevTools console**: Use browser console to collect video links for batch downloading via online tools like **TOKdownload**.
  - **Chrome extension (myfaveTT)**: Create a second account to download videos from your primary account easily.
- Backup your videos as a precaution against potential service bans.

sources.title: How to bulk download and save your TikTok videos

title: Instagram Reels Introduces New Features Amid TikTok Ban in the U.S.
summary:
- Instagram introduces a new tab in the Reels feed displaying videos liked by friends.
- This feature is reminiscent of the old activity feed removed in 2019.
- Instagram aims to enhance social interaction over content shared among friends.
- Users can see which friends liked a post and left notes on Reels.
- Concerns raised about privacy and users' willingness to share their likes publicly.
- Competitive context with TikTok, as Reels attempts to draw users in during potential TikTok ban.
- Instagram announced an update to Reels coinciding with the U.S. TikTok ban effective January 19.
- New features include seeing content liked by friends and a reply bar for direct responses.
- Meta aims to capture TikTok users, especially creators who may struggle to monetize on alternative platforms.

sources.title: Instagram will show your friends what Reels you’ve liked
Instagram Reels adds new features as TikTok is banned in the U.S.

title: Instagram Reels rolls out new features for U.S. users as TikTok gets banned
summary:
- Instagram announced updates to its Reels feature as TikTok faces a ban in the U.S. starting January 19.
- New features will allow users to see content that friends have liked or commented on through a small banner.
- A new 'reply bar' will let users easily respond to their friends' interactions with Reels content.
- Meta aims to attract TikTok users, especially creators, following the ban.

sources.title: Instagram Reels rolls out new features for U.S. users as TikTok gets banned

title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale
summary:
- The Kindle Colorsoft Signature Edition has dropped to $229.99, a $50 discount, for Prime members.
- It is Amazon’s first e-reader with a color display, featuring 32GB storage, waterproofing, and wireless charging support.
- The 7-inch display offers superior color reproduction but has a maximum resolution of 300ppi that reduces when using color.
- The battery life is advertised at eight weeks, shorter than the Paperwhite’s twelve weeks.
- Some early units suffered from a yellow discoloration issue, which Amazon claims to have fixed with hardware and software updates.

sources.title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale

title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January
summary:
• January is the peak time for fitness tech companies to market New Year's resolutions.
• Introduction of "Quitter’s day", the second Friday in January when many abandon their resolutions, prompting Apple to release a motivational ad.
• The author experienced personal challenges at CES, highlighting the pressures of fitness tracking and reminders.
• Many quit their resolutions due to unrealistic expectations, not because of the technology itself.
• The author suggests turning off wearable notifications and trusting oneself in fitness journeys.

sources.title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January

title: Microsoft triples down on AI
summary:
- Microsoft announced the formation of a new AI engineering group called CoreAI, led by Jay Parikh, to enhance its AI platform and tools.
- The company introduced pay-as-you-go agents for its relaunched Copilot Chat and bundled AI features into Microsoft 365, raising subscription prices by $3 per month.
- Microsoft aims to automate services traditionally performed by humans, shifting from software-as-a-service to service-as-software, while addressing concerns from employees about the emphasis on AI.

sources.title: Microsoft triples down on AI

title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms
summary:
- The U.S. government imposed sanctions on a China-based cybersecurity firm, Sichuan Juxinhe Network Technology, linked to the Salt Typhoon hacking group.
- Salt Typhoon is responsible for the largest telecom hack in U.S. history, affecting major companies like AT&T and Verizon.
- The group gained access to sensitive communications of U.S. officials and law enforcement data.
- OFAC also sanctioned Yin Kecheng, linked to a recent hack of the U.S. Treasury, which involved remote access to employee workstations using a stolen private key.

sources.title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms

title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early
summary:
- Nintendo is offering previews of the Switch 2 at live events across North America, Europe, and Asia.
- Demo cities include New York, Los Angeles, Dallas, and Toronto; registration details can be found on Nintendo’s website.
- Attendees must have a Nintendo account, and registration opens on January 17th, closing on January 26th.
- Tickets are free but awarded by lottery; only one time slot can be registered for per participant.

sources.title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early

title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search
summary:
- Google mandates users to enable JavaScript to use Google Search to enhance security and performance.
- The requirement aims to protect against bots and spam, improving search result quality.
- Approximately 95% of websites use JavaScript, but the change could hinder accessibility for some users.
- Users disabling JavaScript represent less than 0.1% of searches, translating to millions of users without JS.
- The new policy could disrupt third-party tools that analyze Google Search trends and rankings.

sources.title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search

title: Castlevania: Nocturne’s second season is another soft-spoken knockout
summary:
- Season 2 continues the story from Season 1, focusing on Richter Belmont's fight against Erzsebet Báthory during the French Revolution.
- The narrative emphasizes personal struggles and relationships amidst the backdrop of war and political unrest.
- Key characters like Erzsebet and Drolta face moral conflicts, highlighting the theme of personal transformation in the face of violence.
- The visual quality of the season is praised, particularly during action scenes, adding to the overall storytelling.
- Despite strong character development, some characters, like Annette, are noted to have less screen time compared to others.
- Season 2 is now available for streaming on Netflix, continuing its reputation as a standout video game adaptation.

sources.title: Castlevania: Nocturne’s second season is another soft-spoken knockout

title: Automakers sue to block Biden’s ‘flawed’ automatic emergency braking rule
summary:
- The Alliance of Automotive Innovation filed a lawsuit against a new rule mandating automatic emergency braking (AEB) by 2029.
- Major automakers including Ford, GM, and Toyota are represented in the suit, aiming to repeal the regulation they describe as “flawed.”
- The rule requires vehicles to automatically stop to avoid collisions at speeds up to 62mph and detect pedestrians at various speeds.
- NHTSA stated the rule is practicable and necessary for increasing safety standards in new vehicles.
- The auto alliance claims current technology cannot meet the requirements and prefers a previous voluntary agreement on AEB implementation.
- Consumer advocates support the rule, arguing it is crucial for roadway safety and should be achievable by the 2029 deadline.

sources.title: Automakers sue to block Biden’s ‘flawed’ automatic emergency braking rule

title: Nintendo omits original Donkey Kong Country Returns team from the remaster’s credits
summary:
- The launch of Donkey Kong Country Returns HD did not credit the original Retro Studios team members.
- Nintendo has addressed the omission, stating they value all contributions in game development.
- Crediting issues have been a recurrent problem in the industry, with previous controversies involving Metroid Prime and external translators.

sources.title: Nintendo omits original Donkey Kong Country Returns team from the remaster’s credits

title: AT&T pulls its 5G internet service in NY over new affordable internet law
summary:
- AT&T has announced it will discontinue its [5G Internet Air service](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/17/24346159/att-new-york-affordable-broadband-act-5g) in New York due to the state’s [Affordable Broadband Act](https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/bills/2021/A6259) becoming effective.
- Existing users will have 45 days to transition to another provider without charges.
- The Affordable Broadband Act requires large providers to offer two affordable plans for low-income households, citing download speeds of 25Mbps for $15 and up to 200Mbps for $20.
- AT&T's Internet Air provided speeds of 40 to 140Mbps for $55 per month but chose to exit the market instead of adjusting to regulatory compliance.
- The law had been delayed due to pushback but was upheld after the US Supreme Court declined to intervene in December.
- AT&T argues that the law creates unsustainable rate regulations preventing future investment in broadband infrastructure.

sources.title: AT&T pulls its 5G internet service in NY over new affordable internet law

title: CBS considers caving on Trump censorship lawsuit to save Paramount merger
summary:
- Donald Trump has filed a $10 billion lawsuit against CBS over the editing of a 60 Minutes interview with Kamala Harris.
- CBS' parent company, Paramount Global, is considering settling the lawsuit as it faces a government review of its merger with Skydance.
- Incoming FCC chairman Brendan Carr has warned that presidential dissatisfaction with CBS News could complicate the merger review process.
- The lawsuit claims CBS used deceptive practices in reporting on Harris’ response to a question about the war in Gaza.
- Paramount may follow other media companies like Disney in settling legal issues ahead of political changes.

sources.title: CBS considers caving on Trump censorship lawsuit to save Paramount merger

title: The tech bros have front-row seats at Trump’s inauguration, but what they want goes way beyond that
summary:
- In his farewell speech, Joe Biden described the US as an oligarchy, highlighting concerns about wealth concentration.
- At least 13 billionaires are set to hold government positions under Trump, with an expected cabinet worth $7 billion.
- Silicon Valley figures, including Elon Musk and David Sacks, are poised for significant influence in the Trump administration.
- The article points to a growing convergence of corporate and political power, especially concerning tech and investment sectors.
- There is speculation about the future political strategy of tech moguls, who may seek to reduce regulations and enjoy greater profit margins.

sources.title: The tech bros have front-row seats at Trump’s inauguration, but what they want goes way beyond that

title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at
summary:
- The article discusses the trend of oversized gaming handhelds, specifically the Asus ROG Flow Z13 combined with a GameSir G8 Plus controller.
- The ROG Flow Z13 has a powerful AMD Strix Halo processor and provides high performance for gaming.
- Concerns are raised about the weight and handling of such large devices, which can lead to discomfort during use.
- The article explores the idea that bigger screens might be preferred in future handheld designs despite potential portability issues.
- Comparisons are made with other devices like the Nintendo Switch 2 and Acer Nitro Blaze 11, suggesting a shift in the gaming handheld market.

sources.title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at

title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements
summary:
- Cash App is fined $255 million due to consumer protection violations.
- Block, the parent company, will pay $80 million for not complying with regulations against illicit activities.
- Additionally, Block will pay $120 million to customers and $55 million to the CFPB for weak security measures and fraud incidents.

sources.title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements

title: The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro, one of our favorite video doorbells, is cheaper than ever
summary:
- The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro is on sale for $149.99, a discount of $80, available until February 1st at 12:59AM ET.
- Features include 1536p video, motion detection with three sensors, color night vision, dual-band Wi-Fi, and smart responses.
- Subscription required for advanced features like smart alerts and recorded footage starting at $4.99/month or $49.99/year.
- It shares almost all features with the wired Pro 2 model, including radar motion detection to minimize nuisance notifications.
- Other deals mentioned include the Vornado MVH Whole Room Heater for $49.99 and the Apple Watch Series 9 for $279.

sources.title: The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro, one of our favorite video doorbells, is cheaper than ever

title: Some of the Switch’s 2 first accessories are all about Mario Kart
summary:
- Nacon has revealed a folding desktop steering wheel accessory for the Switch 2’s redesigned Joy-Cons.
- The accessory will be priced at around $30.
- Other accessories announced include carrying cases, screen protectors, silicone wraps, and chargers designed for the Switch 2's ergonomic use in racing games.
- The next entry in the Mario Kart series was teased during the Switch 2 reveal, with more details expected in April 2025.
- Accessories are available on Nacon’s UK site but not for preorder or with shipping dates yet.

sources.title: Some of the Switch’s 2 first accessories are all about Mario Kart

title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations
summary:
- Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Michael Bennet are questioning major tech firms about their $1 million donations to President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration fund.
- Companies including Google, Microsoft, Apple, Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI made these donations to potentially avoid regulatory scrutiny.
- The donations are notably higher than those made to President Joe Biden's 2021 inauguration.
- Lawmakers emphasize concerns about corporate influence over the Trump administration and have requested responses from the companies by January 30th.

sources.title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations

title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California
summary:
- A fire broke out at the Moss Landing Energy Storage Facility, the largest battery power plant in the world.
- Evacuation orders were issued for nearby residents, and parts of Highway 1 were closed.
- County health officials advised residents to shelter indoors and close windows and doors.
- Monterey County Supervisor described the situation as a disaster.
- Vistra will investigate the fire’s cause once it is under control.
- The facility expanded in 2023, adding over 110,000 battery modules for renewable energy storage.
- This incident follows previous battery fires in the area, including one at a PG&E facility in 2022.

sources.title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California

title: Winter running gear: our top training essentials to help you conquer the cold
summary:
- Winter running can be enjoyable and beneficial for mental health.
- Essential gear includes protective headgear, chest lights, and more.
- Key items recommended are balances between warmth, visibility, and breathability.
- Outdoor running accessories are important for safety in low-light conditions.
- Recommendations include various brands and price points for each item's utility.
- Items such as the Arc’teryx balaclava, Proviz chest light, and Shokz headphones are highlighted.
- Emphasis on layering and moisture-wicking materials for comfort during winter workouts.

sources.title: Winter running gear: our top training essentials to help you conquer the cold

title: Instagram Reels can be 3 minutes long now + Instagram profile grids are going to feature rectangles instead of squares
summary:
- Instagram is changing profile grids from squares to rectangles starting this weekend.
- This decision was explained by CEO Adam Mosseri as necessary due to more vertical photos and videos being uploaded.
- Users may experience some transitional issues, but the change aims to enhance content display.
- The new grid format follows a limited test conducted in August 2024.
- Instagram is introducing a feature to view videos liked by friends in the Reels feed.
- The maximum length for Reels has been increased to 3 minutes from the previous 90 seconds.
- This update was influenced by user feedback suggesting the previous limit was too short.
- This marks a notable shift from prior statements about maintaining the platform's core identity and avoiding long-form content.
- The option to upload 1.5-minute Reels was introduced over two years ago, and longer durations are still being tested.

sources.title: Instagram profile grids are going to feature rectangles instead of squares
Instagram Reels can be 3 minutes long now

title: Once high-flying proptech startups Divvy Homes and EasyKnock are the latest to struggle
summary:
- Many proptech startups are struggling due to a decline in investments, dropping from $11.1 billion in 2021 to $3.7 billion in 2023.
- Divvy Homes is being acquired by Maymont Homes, while EasyKnock has abruptly shut down amidst lawsuits and regulatory actions.
- Divvy raised over $700 million from investors but faced challenges with high interest rates affecting its business model.
- EasyKnock faced allegations of deceptive practices and financial struggles, leading to its insolvency by the time of shutdown.
- The real estate fintech sector may continue to face similar challenges in 2025 due to high interest rates and lack of funding.

sources.title: Once high-flying proptech startups Divvy Homes and EasyKnock are the latest to struggle

title: Whitney Wolfe Herd Reclaims CEO Role at Bumble Amid Challenges
summary:
- Whitney Wolfe Herd will return as CEO of Bumble in mid-March 2025.
- She succeeds Lidiane Jones, who resigned for personal reasons.
- Bumble's Q3 2024 revenue decreased to $274 million, despite a rise in paying users to 4.3 million.
- The dating app sector faces issues like declining user engagement and increased scam concerns.
- Ann Mather will be appointed chair of the board of directors alongside Wolfe Herd's return.

sources.title: Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd to reclaim CEO position in March
Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd returns as CEO amid a dating app decline
Bumble’s founder will return as CEO in March

title: China Tightens Export Restrictions and Investigates US Chip Subsidies
summary:
* China launches an investigation into US subsidies for semiconductor companies.
* The investigation targets the impact of US subsidies on Chinese firms and global semiconductor markets.
* New export restrictions have been imposed, affecting key materials for semiconductor manufacturing.

- The Supreme Court ruling mandates ByteDance to sell TikTok by January 19 to avoid a ban.
- The Biden administration is leaving TikTok's fate to the incoming Trump administration, which is negotiating a resolution.

title: Samsung ties executive bonuses to stock performance
summary:
- Samsung Electronics will start linking executive bonuses to stock performance from January 2025.
- The stock-based bonus will comprise 50% to 100% of the annual bonus, depending on seniority.
- Executives will be prohibited from selling shares for one to two years.
- This change comes as Samsung competes in the semiconductor market and faces challenges from SK Hynix in AI memory chip production.
- The bonus system will adjust based on market performance; a drop in stock price means fewer shares for executives.
- There are plans to extend this program to non-executive employees by 2026, with voluntary participation and no market performance link.

title: DOJ confirms arrested US Army soldier is linked to AT&T and Verizon hacks
summary:
- U.S. Army soldier Cameron John Wagenius was arrested on December 20, 2024, for transferring confidential phone records from AT&T and Verizon.
- The case is linked to previously indicted hackers who stole data from the cloud computing company Snowflake.
- The breaches affected many companies, with AT&T reporting that nearly all its customer call records were compromised.
- Wagenius claimed access to call logs of prominent figures and threatened to leak stolen files unless demands were met.
- He is currently in custody in Washington state, having been ordered detained on January 8, 2025.

- The ban is linked to fears that Chinese AI could influence US public opinion using TikTok data.
- President Biden chose not to enforce the ban, leaving the decision to President-elect Trump.
- There is bipartisan conflict in Congress about whether TikTok should be allowed to continue operating in the US.
- The ruling emphasizes growing concerns regarding data privacy and national security in the digital age.

title: SpaceX Starship Rocket Explodes During Test Flight, Causing Flight Delays
summary:
- The SpaceX Starship explosion created a colorful debris display, resembling a meteor shower.
- The explosion occurred 8.5 minutes after the launch, during a test of a redesigned propulsion system.
- Flights from Miami and Fort Lauderdale were delayed by up to 45 minutes as the FAA diverted planes around the debris field.
- The launch took place at 5:38 p.m. EST (2238 GMT), and contact was lost shortly after liftoff.
- SpaceX indicated the explosion might have been due to a fire in the ship’s rear section.
- Initial assessments show debris fell within a designated hazard area, reducing potential risks.
- The FAA temporarily slowed plane operations in the area but has since returned to normal.

sources.title: SpaceX’s fiery Starship explosion put on a fantastic show but delayed and diverted flights
Elon Musk’s Starship rocket explodes during SpaceX flight test

title: Reliance’s Jio posts 26% profit growth in Q3 FY25
summary:
- Jio Platforms recorded a 26% year-on-year net profit growth in Q3 FY25, totaling 6,861 crore rupees (approx. US$798 million).
- Revenue from operations increased by 19.2% year-on-year to 33,074 crore rupees (approx. US$3.8 billion).
- Average revenue per user (ARPU) rose to 203.3 rupees (approx. US$2.3), up from 181.7 rupees (approx. US$2.1) last year.
- Subscriber base grew by 2.4% year-on-year to 482 million, with 3.3 million new subscribers added this quarter.
- Jio has over 170 million 5G customers, representing 40% of its total wireless traffic.

title: With full speed ahead on AI investment, does ROI matter?
summary:
- The projected spending on AI is expected to reach $1 trillion in the coming years.
- Companies need to balance between investment and the economic value generated, especially in chip production. 
- Businesses are categorized into three types: Big Tech, supply chain companies, and applied AI businesses, each having different ROI considerations.
- Big Tech can afford to invest heavily without immediate ROI pressure due to their overall solid financial performance.
- Supply chain companies must overinvest in capacity to meet demand despite the risks of overestimating.
- Applied AI companies focus on measured investments with ROI targets, emphasizing strategic spending based on proven progress.
- Historical context is provided, comparing current AI investment trends to the dot-com boom, suggesting potential for both significant risk and reward.

sources.title: With full speed ahead on AI investment, does ROI matter?

title: 3 big predictions for AI in financial services in 2025
summary:
- By 2025, AI will enhance personalized experiences in financial services rather than replacing human roles.
- Collaborative AI will streamline processes, leading to faster and simpler customer interactions.
- Financial service providers will focus on niche solutions tailored for specific customer segments, moving away from one-size-fits-all approaches.
- Success will hinge on leveraging AI to bundle services that address unique customer needs, creating seamless experiences.

sources.title: 3 big predictions for AI in financial services in 2025

title: How Letterboxd went mainstream
summary:
- Letterboxd’s highest-rated film in 2020 was *Minari*, earning $15.5 million globally.
- In 2024, *Dune: Part Two* topped the charts with $714.4 million.
- Letterboxd grew from 1.8 million members in mid-2020 to over 17 million, with six million joining in the last year.
- The platform has transitioned from a niche community to mainstream popularity, expanding beyond film nerds.
